title: TORCHFX: A MODERN APPROACH TO AUDIO DSP WITH PYTORCH AND GPU ACCELERATION
author: Matteo Spanio (Centro di Sonologia Computazionale, University of Padova), Antonio Rodà (Centro di Sonologia Computazionale, University of Padova), ...
relevance_why: The paper integrates audio digital signal processing with deep learning frameworks like PyTorch. This could inform techniques for audio enhancement and restoration in Haohe's research on audio quality improvement.
background: TorchFX is designed to perform efficient audio processing using GPU acceleration and mimics the user-friendly interface of existing audio libraries.
contribution: This paper introduces TorchFX to solve the inefficiencies in existing digital signal processing libraries by leveraging GPU capabilities, achieving significant performance improvements.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing libraries like SciPy provide basic functionality but lack GPU acceleration and user-friendly interfaces for complex processing.
technical_comparison.novelty: TorchFX significantly enhances usability with an object-oriented design and intuitive filter chaining using operator overloading, making it easier to create complex audio processing pipelines.

key_innovation: The introduction of an operator overloading mechanism for intuitive filter chaining allows users to create complex audio signal transformations more smoothly.
real_world_impact: TorchFX has the potential to significantly enhance real-time audio processing applications, thereby improving the usability of AI-based audio manipulation tools in fields such as music production.
limitations: The current version of TorchFX primarily supports CUDA, limiting compatibility to NVIDIA GPUs; broader support for other hardware is still in development.

new_terms.Digital Signal Processing (DSP): **Digital Signal Processing (DSP)** refers to the numerical manipulation of signals, typically in audio, to improve or alter the signal in useful ways.
new_terms.Finite Impulse Response (FIR) filters: **Finite Impulse Response filters** are a type of digital filter characterized by a finite number of impulsive sequences, offering simplicity and stability in audio processing.
new_terms.Infinite Impulse Response (IIR) filters: **Infinite Impulse Response filters** are digital filters that can respond indefinitely to an input signal, which allows for more flexible and potentially complex filtering effects.
